attributes.action: Maria Miller be forced to pay back £45.000
attributes.additional_details:
Parliament’s standards commissioner, said earlier this year that the Culture Secretary Maria Miller should hand back £45,000 in over-claimed allowances for a house in south-west London.

However MPs on the Commons standards committee overruled the commissioner and said Mrs Miller would have to repay just £5,800 and apologise for her “attitude” during the inquiry.

This is not good enough Mrs Miller needs to pay back the full £45.000 or Resign. Make parliament force Mrs Miller to do the right thing and pay back the money she stole from all tax paying people and make more than a 32 sec apology.

rejection.details: This is a matter for the Parliamentary Authorities, not DCMS.
